  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Supervisor",
  "description": "Mshel Homes Limited is a real estate development and marketing company incorporated in 2018 with a unique vision to be the leading real estate company in Nigeria, with an outstanding reputation for honesty, integrity and impeccable customer service.

At Mshel Homes Limited our mission is to create a lifetime relationship with our clientele by deliverying property solutions through innovative and technological driven processes that caters to your real estate needs whilst adhering to the highest standards, systems and performance goals necessary to achieving your dreams.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Supervisor

Job Locations:&nbsp;Abuja

Job Summary


	The Inventory Supervisor will be responsible for overseeing and managing the inventory operations across Mshel Construction&#39;s various project sites.
	This role includes supervising inventory and store office officers at each site, ensuring the accurate tracking, storage, and distribution of materials.
	The Inventory Supervisor will collaborate closely with the Procurement and Finance departments to ensure the timely availability of materials and the financial accuracy of inventory records, supporting the success of all ongoing and upcoming projects.


Key Responsibilities
Inventory Management Across Project Sites:


	Supervise and manage the inventory operations at multiple project sites, ensuring that each site maintains proper stock levels, storage, and distribution of materials.
	Oversee the monitoring of inventory movements between project sites and the main warehouse, ensuring efficiency and accuracy in material transfers.
	Ensure that inventory records are consistently updated across all project sites, utilizing inventory management systems and software.


Supervision of Inventory/Store Office Officers:


	Lead and supervise inventory/store office officers at each project site, ensuring that they follow standard operating procedures for inventory control, material handling, and record-keeping.
	Provide guidance and training to inventory officers, ensuring adherence to safety, quality, and procedural standards.
	Conduct regular site visits to monitor inventory processes, resolve any operational challenges, and ensure that materials are stored and handled correctly.


Collaboration with Procurement and Finance:


	Work closely with the Procurement team to forecast material requirements across all project sites and ensure timely procurement of materials.
	Collaborate with the Finance department to ensure accurate financial reporting of inventory, including stock valuation and cost tracking.
	Assist Procurement in managing relationships with suppliers, ensuring the smooth ordering and delivery of materials to multiple sites.


Logistics and Distribution:


	Oversee the distribution of materials from the warehouse to various project sites, ensuring timely and accurate deliveries.
	Coordinate transportation logistics to ensure that materials are delivered efficiently and stored properly at each site.
	Work with project managers and site supervisors to ensure that materials are available as needed and according to project schedules.


Quality Control and Safety:


	Monitor the quality of materials being received at each project site, ensuring they meet company standards and project specifications.
	Ensure compliance with safety regulations regarding the handling, storage, and transportation of materials, particularly hazardous materials.
	Implement and monitor safety protocols at all project sites to minimize accidents and material loss.


Reporting and Documentation:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of inventory across all project sites, tracking material movements, stock levels, and usage.
	Prepare and submit regular inventory reports to the Procurement and Finance departments, highlighting stock levels, shortages, and material usage trends.
	Identify discrepancies between physical and recorded stock, investigating and resolving any issues promptly.


Team Management and Training:


	Manage and mentor the inventory/store office officers across all project sites, fostering a positive and productive work environment.
	Provide ongoing training and development for the inventory team to improve their skills and ensure consistency in inventory management practices across all sites.
	Evaluate the performance of inventory officers and provide feedback to improve efficiency and accuracy.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or related field.
	3-5 years of experience in inventory management, with a focus on overseeing multiple project sites or locations.
	Strong knowledge of inventory management systems and software (e.g., SAP, or similar tools).
	Proven experience in supervising teams and managing inventory at large construction sites or across multiple locations.
	Excellent organizational, leadership, and problem-solving skills.
	Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience with construction materials and project site inventory management.
	Familiarity with financial tracking and cost management in inventory operations.
	Experience in logistics and transportation coordination.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@mshelconstruction.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

IT Support Specialist Job at PalmPay




        
    

        
        PalmPay is an Africa-focused fintech firm, launched in 2019. PalmPay is a mobile payments platform that offers a number of financial services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Support Specialist
Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
User Support & Service Delivery:
     

            
    




	Provide first and second-level technical support for hardware, software, and network issues.
	Troubleshoot and resolve incidents related to laptops, printers, email, and collaboration tools.
	Manage user onboarding and offboarding (account setup, access provisioning, device assignment).
	Maintain and update IT service tickets, ensuring timely resolution and proper escalation when necessary.


Network & System Administration:


	Support LAN/WAN operations including wireless access points, switches, and firewalls.
	Monitor network performance and report outages or degradations to the IT Operations Manager.
	Assist in the configuration of routers, switches, and VPN connections.


IT Asset & Inventory Management:


	Maintain accurate inventory of IT equipment and software licenses.
	Support procurement by providing input on technical specifications and compatibility.


Security & Compliance:


	Ensure endpoint devices are compliant with company security policies (antivirus, encryption, patching).
	Participate in periodic system audits and assist in implementing security recommendations.
	Support implementation of security awareness programs and incident response drills.


Operational Efficiency:


	Participate in IT projects such as office network setup, relocations, or system upgrades.
	Document recurring issues and propose improvements to reduce downtime.
	Provide feedback and recommendations to improve IT policies, standards, and procedures.
